definition: to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen

sentences.english: This car answers to the description of Mr. Brown's stolen car .
sentences.chinese: 这辆车与布朗先生失窃的汽车的描述相吻合。

sentences.english: The theft had happened many years ago, according to Gregorovitch.
sentences.chinese: 据格里戈维奇的记忆，这次失窃发生在许多年以前。

sentences.english: The Keyless Locking Mailbox turns the tables on mail thieves.
sentences.chinese: 不带钥匙的邮箱锁改善了邮件失窃的情况。

sentences.english: It may well have been stolen in France.
sentences.chinese: 该车很有可能是法国失窃车辆。

sentences.english: The imminentrobbery of the Crown Jewels.
sentences.chinese: 即将发生的皇冠钻石失窃案。

sentences.english: The theft of the jade vase caused much excitement.
sentences.chinese: 玉瓶的失窃引起很大的骚动。

sentences.english: When his house was burgled, he made a claim on the insurance.
sentences.chinese: 他的住宅失窃后，他向保险公司提出索取赔偿的要求。

sentences.english: He insured his car against accident, theft, and fire.
sentences.chinese: 他给车子保意外险，失窃险和火险。

sentences.english: Identity theft and data breaches are some of the fastest-growing crimes in United States.
sentences.chinese: 身份失窃和数据泄露是美国增长最快的犯罪类型之一。

sentences.english: Police are investigating the theft of computers from the company's offices.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查这家公司办公室里的计算机失窃案。

sentences.english: QiLe asked big people the truth about the theft.
sentences.chinese: 祁乐问大民有关失窃事件的真相。

sentences.english: Mr Wang, do you keep it a secret about the stolen silver in qiantang?
sentences.chinese: 王大人，王大人，钱塘县库银失窃之事捂住了吧？

sentences.english: The sudden increase in thefts in the school disturbed the parents.
sentences.chinese: 学校中的失窃现象突然增多令父母深感不安。

sentences.english: NICB also released a list of the metropolitan areas with the highest vehicle theft rates in the country.
sentences.chinese: NICB同时发布了汽车失窃率最高的10个城市。

sentences.english: She will shed light on the case of stolen jewels.
sentences.chinese: 好将能够揭示这次珠宝失窃案。

definition: to have sth stolen/to lose to theft/robbed
to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to return something to its rightful owner
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
